Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Large-Head Metal-on-Metal and Conventional Metal-on-Polyethylene Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 104 patients were randomised

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients requiring primary THA.

Intervention.evidence: 104 patients were randomised to receive either cementless MoM THA (50 patients) or cementless MoP THA (54 patients)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates long-term outcomes of large-head MoM THA compared to conventional metal-on-polyethylene (MoP) THA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was survivorship free from revision at 10 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 104 patients were randomised to receive either cementless MoM THA (50 patients) or cementless MoP THA (54 patients) between January 2006 and December 2008.

Result_Outcome.evidence: survivorship free from revision was similar between MoP and MoM groups (95% [95% CI 85% to 98%] vs. 92% [95% CI 82% to 98%]; p = 0.6)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included pseudotumor formation and elevated ion levels.
